column4: Is there an ubuntu livecd that I can use to clean viruses off a windows box?
yea, the ubuntu, er livecd
that has clamav?
you can install it once it's up and running
i assume clamav is a linux irus scanner for windows viruses (virii?)
yep.  Not sure what detection rates are these days; last I knew it was 50-60%
Norton is only 85%
well once you have the LiveCD running you can install clamav and run it from there
you familiar with installation?
quite, though I don't mess with windows much...  Is ntfs rw pretty easy to get going now in ubuntu?
plugnplay
i know a virus scanner thats got a 100% detection rate. it's called Windows
right...  I can't believe people are still using that buggy os...
so why do you have it installed?
fixing two friends' computers that aren't brave enough to cross over to the light side
one of them is Vista, which I have NEVER gotten farther into than looking in the start menu
ah. you *could* put them a Windows theme on Ubuntu and see how long it takes for them to notice :P
no, they have software that won't run.. They'd catch on
ive just had a week at someone else's vista PC - its not all that great
Thanks for info; I burned xubuntu the other day so I have a new cd; going to go use it
np
I'ts downright terrible; though I will give it a "pretty" rating, whatever that's good for when everything esle is useless...  See you later
